content: non-cooperation brick knitting pattern hello and welcome to the knitting pattern this pattern is for knitting a brick which is technically for entertainment purposes only and not meant to provide meaningful structure to say some stairs or a house each brick is unique and the dimensions provided are meant to be guides not laws so if your brick is a little bigger or a little smaller than the measurements given don t worry at least you re not planning to wear it if you want to use a thicker or thinner yarn than i did just use needles that give you a tight gauge typically one size below the smallest recommended size for your yarn and work to the dimensions given below not the stitch and row counts i also didn t block my bricks but feel free to block them either through wet blocking or steaming before stuffing them especially if you would like the crispiest possible edges the brick is knit flat by making a bigger rectangle containing alternating stockinette and garter stitch sections then stitches are picked up along the first stockinette section to make the two remaining sides the ends of each brick choosing your own adventure below the ends are then either seamed or knit together with the rest of the sides creating the 3d brick shape remember this brick is not a replacement for therapy and activism talk to a therapist if you are experiencing anxiety or depression get out their and protest for your rights and the rights of those who can t advocate for themselves volunteer if you can donate to causes you care about if you can help your community as much as you re able none of us are alone in any of this find your people and get to work anyway here s some sillier knitting stuff non-cooperation brick knitting pattern pa ge | 1 yarn 50 g or approximately 200-250 yards/180-230 meters of fingering weight 14 wpi yarn i encourage stash diving here using up yarn leftovers is one of the great joys in life in any color for my samples i used cat sandwich fibers glitzie rowan fine tweed with some brooklyn tweed loft and sandnes garn sunday petiteknit all were wonderful needles us 1 2 25 mm circular or straight knitting needles the entire pattern is worked back and forth in row but i find it easier to use circular needles whether i m working in the round or not use what you prefer other supplies scissors tapestry needle poly-fil stuffing and/or foam for stuffing the brick maybe a row counter if you don t trust your own ability to count abbreviations k = knit o p = purl o co = cast on o bobble = bind off o k2tog = knit two together o ssk = slip slip knit two together through back loop o gauge 2 x 2 on us 1 = 16 stitches by 21 row finished size 7 5 x 3
